title: AN EIGHTH DOCTOR AND MARY SHELLEY ADVENTURE
author: RICK BRIGGS
filename: 154 - The Witch from the Well - Rick Briggs_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
1: EXT. TRANCHARD’S FOLLY
(FX: BIG EARTHMOVING EQUIPMENT — WE’RE IN THE MIDDLE OF A
CONSTRUCTION SITE. )
Hold it!/This way!/To me! [ETC]
Careful there, old man! Watch the conservatory!
FX: A JCB SHIFTS GEAR LOUDLY.
(APPROACHING) Mr Portillon!
Your men must be more careful, Janek. Tranchards Folly is an old house. We don’t want it damaged after it’s stood so long, do we?
There’s something you should see, Mr Portillon.
A problem?
Not necessarily.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 2
2: EXT. SPINNEY
(FX: FADE UP. LABOURERS WORKING — CUTTING AWAY FOLIAGE. HATCHETS AND A CHAINSAW. )
(APPROACHING) Take a break, boys.
FX: THE WORK STOPS.
(STEPPING FORWARD) Good Lord! What is that?
My men were clearing the trees. They found it this morning. Looks like it has been here a long time, hey?
(FX: CROSS TO FINICIA AND LUCERN, WATCHING FROM BEHIND NEARBY FOLIAGE. )
(SOTTO) They’ve found the well.
(SOTTO) But it’s too soon, Finicia! We’re not ready!
(SOTTO) Quiet, Lucern!
FX: CROSS BACK TO:
The well has been capped. Stone like that would have taken much work to move.
(FX: CLEARING VINES) Yes... (EXCITED) Look, there’s writing on aa om
Vandals everywhere.
Very talented vandals. See how carefully the characters have been carved?
Perhaps. I do not know this language.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 3
Me neither. (BEAT) Can your men move the stone? Open the shaft?
We thought you would ask this. All is ready. (FX: CLAPS HANDS) (TO LABOURERS) You heard Mr Portillon! Take the strain! Move the stone!
(FX: GRUNTS AND STRAINING. WOODEN LEVERS CREAK. THE HEAVY STONE RUMBLES AS IT SHIFTS.)
It’s lifting!
(FX: A WOODEN LEVER SNAPS! THE STONE ROLLS FREE — IT BOUNCES, CRASHES INTO A DITCH. THE LABOURERS CHEER. )
Well is clear.
Excellent!
(FX: SLIGHT ECHO, TO SUGGEST PEERING DOWN WELL SHAFT) I see nothing down here, Mr Portillon.
(CALLING OFF) Anyone got a torch...?
FX: SCUTTLING, OFF, DOWN WELL. A PERSON CLAMBERING UP SHAFT
One moment. I do see something. I see — (POLISH) Do Diabla!
(FX: WITH A SHRIEK, THE WITCH ERUPTS OUT OF THE SHAFT. A VOICE THAT COULD BE FEMALE — COULD BE! — RECITES NAMES, MUTTERING LIKE DUSTIN HOFFMAN IN ‘RAIN MAN’.)
Ikodar! Euclon! Davarox!
FX: SHRIEK! SWOOSH! SCUTTLE!
What is that thing? Is it — a person? Look at its hands — they’re like talons!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 4
(PANICKED) Run, boys! Run!!!
Watch out, Janek. To your right!
Wha-?
(FX: WITCH ATTACKS FOREMAN, SLASHING AT HIM WITH ITS LONG NAILS.
SCREAMS AND DIES!
(ADVANCING ON ALEISTER) Ometak! Rankar! Sefass!
Please. I mean you no harm. Stay back. Please!
SHRIEKS, POUNCING ON ALEISTER
SCREAMS
(FX: CROSS TO FINICIA AND LUCERN WATCHING THE WORKMEN’S PANICKED STAMPEDE! WILD SHRIEKS FROM THE THING AS IT FALLS UPON THEM — MASSACRING THEM! )
(MORE AWESTRUCK THAN HORRIFIED) She killed him!
(PANICKED) She’1ll kill them all, sister! We have to get back to the house!
No. What if Portillon had the device with him when he died?
You don’t mean —
We have to search the body. (FX: MOVES OFF, THROUGH FOLIAGE)
Wait! Don’t let her see you! (FX: FOLLOWS HER INTO CLEARING)
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 5
FX: DISTANT SCREAMS — WITCH SLAUGHTERING LABOURERS
Don’t panic. She’s gone. Chasing the labourers. (COMING UPON ALEISTER’S BODY) Here he is. I’1l check his pockets. Look out for the witch. Warn me if she comes back!
Hurry, Finicia. I can’t see her any more.
(SEARCHING HIS POCKETS) It’s not in his jacket...
FX: SUDDENLY: FOLIAGE PARTS BESIDE LUCERN.
SHRIEKS
Finicia, she’s here! She’s -
FX: THE WITCH KNOCKS LUCERN OVER
Brother!
(FX: A COMMOTION FROM OFF. MARY BURSTS THROUGH THE FOLIAGE LIKE AN AVENGING ANGEL)
(COMMANDING) Monster! Leave that boy be!
HISSES IN THE MANNER OF THE ALIEN QUEEN IN ALIENS
(STARTLED) Who are you?
(HUSHED VOICE) On this occasion, I think it best we postpone our introductions. (CALLING TO WITCH) Did you not hear me? Get thee gone!
(CURIOUS) Ikodar...? Davarox...?
(TO LUCERN) Get over here, boy. Hurry!
FX: LUCERN STUMBLES TO HIS FEET & JOINS THEM
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 6
But — where did you come from? Who let you in?
No time now. (TO LUCERN) Are you hurt, boy? Can you run?
You watch me.
(MENACING) Ikodar! Davarox!
Then...
SHRIEKS, POUNCING
RUN!!!
FX: ALL RUN
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 7
3: INT. TARDIS (CONTROL ROOM
FX: FADE UP. TARDIS TICKING OVER. CONTROLS ARE ADJUSTED.
There. Running like a dream again. Why they decommissioned these old beauties I’1l never understand...
(FX: SUDDENLY, THE DOOR BANGS OPEN! MARY, FINICIA AND LUCERN FALL INTO THE TARDIS. GASPING FOR BREATH. )
Ah, Mary — you’re back from your stroll.
(FRANTIC!) Doctor — shut the door!
Won’t you introduce me to your new friends?
(FX: A SHRIEK FROM OUTSIDE! SCUTTLING FOOTSTEPS! THE THING FROM THE WELL IS ALMOST UPON THEM! )
(RUSHING FORWARD) Dineel! Aleza! Bak’guaan...!
What on Gallifrey...?
Doctor — the door! NOW!
What? Ah. Yes. (LEAPING FOR IT)
(FX: A SWITCH IS THROWN. SOMETHING OUTSIDE BANGS AGAINST THE DOOR AS IT CLOSES, A FRACTION OF A SECOND TOO LATE! )
(BREATHLESS) What is this place? Where are we?
(DITTO) Safe.
(WALKING FORWARD) At the risk of repeating myself, Mistress Shelley: who are these children?
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 8
Don’t you know who we are, Doctor?
No. Should I?
(HURRIEDLY) What my sister means is, we live here, at Tranchard’s Folly.
I’m Finicia. This is my brother, Lucern.
Sorry, I don’t keep up with Debrett’s Peerage.
(AWKWARD PAUSE. THE DOCTOR IS UNSURE ABOUT THE NEWCOMERS. HAVE THEY MET BEFORE? WHY AREN’T THEY SHOCKED BY THE TARDIS?)
It was fortunate for our young guests that I’d resolved to explore our surroundings while you made your repairs, Doctor.
Repairs? Is the machine not safe?
Nothing to worry about. Just a matter of sequential regression.
(TO TWINS) Please, excuse the Doctor. Often he gabbles thus.
Fast return switch. Brings the TARDIS back to its previous co- ordinates. It engaged by accident and brought us here. Which was odd, don’t you think, Finicia?
Why odd?
Well, I’ve never been here before. (FX: CLAPS HANDS DECISIVELY) Right, then, children — let’s see if we can’t take a closer look at this mystery assailant of yours...
LUCERN/FINICIA: We’re not children.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 9
(SNIFFS) Good. This isn’t a créche.
How old are you, my dear?
Seventeen. So’s he.
We’re twins.
Barely younger than I, Doctor. (PROVING THAT THEY’RE NOT
) And I have a child of my own waiting for me, you’1l recall.
You've also got a novel in you that’1ll be revered as long as the English language abides. I doubt this pair ever wrote anything longer than 140 characters.
FX: SCANNER WHOOSH!
Aha, there she is...
(FX: OVER SCANNER, THE WITCH FROM THE WELL SCRATCHES AT THE TARDIS DOOR. )
(DISTORTED, VIA SCANNER) Izala. Tutanon...!
FX: BANGS ON THE WOOD — WITHOUT EFFECT. SHRIEKS!
Well, she won’t get in with only her fingernails. Impressive though they are.
Poor creature. There is something wretched about it, I think.
Did you not see what it did, to those workmen?
What it wanted to do to us?
You’1l have to excuse Mary. She tends to side with the monster...
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 10
(COLD) It killed Aleister Portillon. Thirteenth Earl of Whetstone.
Our father.
Forgive me.
Are you sure it can’t get in?
Quite sure. I wish I knew what it was, though, and what it’s doing on twenty-first century Earth. Some sort of mutant?
It’s a witch.
A witch?
The witch from the well.
The well?
It’s an old well. It must have been hidden for centuries. They opened it just now and the witch came out.
Hmm.
FX: HE STARTS FLICKING SWITCHES AND CONTROLS.
What are you doing, Doctor?
The TARDIS has an electrical library — greater than Alexandria, the Doctor claims. Quite astonishing.
It’s all right, Mary. I’m sure Finicia is familiar with search engines, albeit the TARDIS database is slightly larger than the ones she’s used to.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 11
(FX: A LITTLE ELECTRONIC BURBLE INDICATES THAT THE INFORMATION HAS COME UP ON THE SCREEN)
Here we are... Hmm. It seems there used to be a village on this Site, back in the seventeenth century. Tranchard’s Fell.
We know.
(HURRIEDLY) Our house was named after it.
(SKIM-READING) Usual brouhaha over land rights, retainers wages, poaching.. Aha! Here she is.
The witch?
Well, a witch scare. Coercion, torture, execution. Barbarians!
What did we tell you? The witch.
Well here’s something you couldn’t have told me. Six months before the scare, a Varaxil ship crossing Earth’s solar system was lost.
And you believe this ship ran aground here? Like the fallen Cybermen in Vienna?

It’s not hard to see what might have happened. A bunch of superstitious locals capture a crash-landed alien, call ita witch and bury it alive down a well. You know, there are times when your species appals me.
The seventeenth century was an uncivilised age.
Aren’t they all...
But surely such a cosmic traveller could not still be alive, after three or four hundred years down a well?
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 12

That’s the thing about us aliens. We’re not the same as you. Different lifespans, different anatomy, different opinions. (TO LUCERN & FINICIA) By the way, Lucern and Finicia — yes, there are such things as aliens. Yes, this is a time and space machine. No, I wouldn’t believe it either.
You just carry on, Doctor.
Kids today. No sense of wonder. (BEAT) Here’s what we’re going to do: we’re going back in time, back to Tranchard’s Fell.
(NERVOUS) Why?
So we can find out exactly what happened here, all whose years
ago. Find out what that creature is, and how to help it.
Help it? It killed our father. We should kill it in return.
An eye for an eye and we all go blind. Right, hold on
everyone. Seventeenth century here we come!
(FX: HE THROWS SWITCHES. THE TIME COLUMN VWORPS! AS THE SHIP DEMATERIALISES, CROSSFADE TO: )
4: CLEARING NEAR TRANCHARD’S FOLLY
FX: THE TARDIS DEMATERIALISING
Izala. Tutanon. Doctor. (CACKLES) Doctor...! (CONTINUES CACKLING)
FX: CROSSFADE.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 13
5: EXT. FOREST
(FX: LEAVES RUSTLE. BIRDS. SMALL STREAM LAPPING. THE IDYLL’S INTERRUPTED AS THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS. )
(INHALING) Ahhh! Taste that pre-Industrial Revolution air, kids! Not a pollutant for miles!
(EMERGING) Was it difficult, Doctor, finding a safe place to land your ship?
Without hitting a tree, she means.
The TARDIS does most of the work. I just point her in the right direction.
You mean, it doesn’t need you?
We need each other. But she can always find her way back.
Always?
(EMERGING) So the TARDIS was working properly, after all?
That’s sequential regression for you. All the right co- ordinates, just not necessarily in the right order.
(TAKING A FEW PACES AWAY FROM THE TARDIS) Look, there’s a farm down there! We must be close to the village.
Let’s take a look around. Come on, you lot. Follow me! (HE STARTS TO SCRAMBLE DOWN A SLOPE, LOSES HIS FOOTING & TUMBLES) Woooah! (MINOR LANDSLIDE, DOCTOR BOUNCING WITH IT.) Ow! Ooof!
(CALLING) Doctor! Are you all right?
(CALLING, BELOW) Watch your step, that slope’s tricky!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 14
6: EXT. WOODLAND PATH (A FEW MOMENTS LATER
FX: FADE UP. THE DOCTOR AND MARY WALKING
The seventeenth century, Doctor! Milton, Rubens, Purcell! How thrilling.
The Great Plague, the Thirty Years’ War, the execution of Filippo Bruno for the heresy of calling the Sun a star.
FX: THEY STOP WALKING
Travellers from the stars, marooned like Selkirk was — will be - on foreign shores. Are you acquainted with these Varaxil folk?

Actually, they rather keep to themselves. Their technology's based on Odic energy. It’s a kind of alternative science — the principle behind it being the harnessing of the paranormal. It’s a little hard to explain — or to understand.
I understand an oxymoron when I hear it, Doctor. A science based on superstition?

Conventional physics is the natural order of the cosmos. The existence of Odic energy contradicts every natural law we know. Nonetheless, it appears that evolution produces rare minds among every sentient race that are able to channel it. Most of them don’t even know what they’re doing. They become healers, prophets... madmen.
That seems a somewhat medieval outlook.

The Varaxils isolated Odic energy; they synthesized it; they built their civilisation on its power. It’s incredibly sophisticated, closer to an art than a science. But to people from this period of Earth’s history, the Varaxil’s Odic energy would be indistinguishable from magic. Witchcraft.
Then we must find that ship of theirs.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 15

Indeed so. (THEY SET OFF AGAIN) Being accused of witchcraft is something the Varaxils came to expect. Many supposedly enlightened races denounced their science as heresy. The Varaxils became pariahs. They were persecuted throughout your galaxy. Rather tragic.
(CALING FROM OFF) Doctor! Mary! We’re here!
It seems the twins have found the farmhouse. Come on.
FX: THEY BREAK INTO A TROT.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 16
7: EXT. DESERTED FARM
(FX: A LOW WHISTLING WIND, OTHERWISE SILENCE. THE FARM’S DESERTED, IN A WAY THAT GIVES YOU GOOSEBUMPS. )
The place is deserted.
I don’t like this. It feels all wrong.
Wrong? Of course it’s wrong. Everything’s wrong, Lucern.
(APPROACHING) Looks like no one’s home.
No livestock either. And the fields are unploughed.
(RATTLES PADLOCK ON BARN DOOR) And yet this barn’s locked up. Why lock an abandoned barn?
Unless it isn’t really abandoned.
THE THOUGHT HANGS IN THE AIR
We should be getting on.
To Tranchard’s Fell? Won’t the villagers be surprised by our appearance?
Just say you’re from London. That usually works. Look, we won't find the Varaxil ship without a little help from the locals.
What makes you think they’1l know where it crashed?
They’re locals — locals always know these sorts of things. Just leave the talking to me. With any luck, they’ll bea friendly bunch.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 17
8: EXT. TRANCHARD’S FELL (MAIN SQUARE
FX: FADE UP AN ANGRY MOB, HOWLING FOR BLOOD
Let her drown!/Beat the Devil from her!/She levelled my grain! [ETC]
(FX: BEING DRAGGED BY MOB, IN CHAINS) Please, leave me be! I’ve no darkness in my heart!
Don’t you listen to none of her whickering! She’s a witch!
Aye!
Her coven cursed this village when the Devil fell to earth on Vetter’s Tor last spring. Lights in the sky, the land aflame! (CHANTING) Prick her flesh! Prick her flesh!
(TAKING UP THE CRY) Prick her flesh! Prick her flesh!
FX: CONTINUES UNDER AS WE CROSS TO CLOSE BY. HUSHED TONES:
Friendly, did you say, Doctor?
The woman in chains. Who is she, do you think?
I don’t know. Oh, but this is barbaric!
Vigilante justice. This is going to be ugly. (BEAT) Mary, get the twins away from here.
There’s a Church. We’1ll be safe in The Lord’s house. What will
you be doing, in the meantime?
Never you mind. Just look after the children.
(FX: MARY, LUCERN & FINICIA MOVE OFF. AS THEY DO, BEATRIX BREAKS OFF CHANTING. THE MOB CONTINUES. )
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 18
(TO THE DOCTOR) Hey, you there!
Who, me?
(APPROACHING) Who’s your fleet-footed friend? Looked like she had the Squire’s young ‘uns with her...
The Squire’s-? Ah, yes: blue blood. I daresay there’s a familial resemblance. (ALOUD) Never mind about that. Tell me about the... ah... witch.
Agnes Bates? She were the one took me from my mother’s womb. Birthed most of Tranchard’s Fell, she has. We’re lucky we don’t all carry Satan’s mark!
(FX: A COMMOTION, OFF. AGNES HOLDING HER OWN AGAINST A COUPLE OF STRAPPING MEN.)
Hold her tight!/Don’t let her get away!
(OFF, SHOUTING) Get off me, Davy Tyler! Have you forgot I made you breathe when you had the pox as a babe? (BEAT) I ain’t gonna run! I want to be heard, that’s all!
(HISSES, URGENT) Block your ears, sir! You don’t want to be listenin’ to words off the Devil’s own forked tongue!
If there is a devil here, then I very much doubt he’s in Agnes Bates.
(OFF, ADDRESSING THE MOB) There ain’t no Hell but what the ignorant build! None of you ain’t seen what I’ve seen! Other spheres in an infinite void. Silver ships sailing between the [stars] — !
(FX: VILLAGERS JEER. ROTTEN FRUIT’S HURLED. SPLATCH! THEN MORE FRUIT — A VOLLEY! AGNES SPLUTTERS, STRUCK REPEATEDLY. )
Fruit! Why does someone always bring fruit?
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 19
Animals! I’ve seen sights such as would make you weep with the beauty of them. And I’ve seen you, Lord of Time!
FX: SHE’S DRAGGED AWAY, STILL STRUGGLING.
What did she say-?
I told you, sir, you don’t want to listen to her devil words.
Where are they taking her?
To the cells. Master Kincaid’s on his way from Lincoln. He’1l get her confession, if he has to pull her lying tongue by the root!
Who is this Master Kincaid?
Where’ve you been, sir? John Kincaid — he’s Parliament’s man.
The Witch-Pricker!
Ah.
(FX: MOB MOVES OFF, CHANTING IN THE WAKE OF AGNES AND HER GUARDS. )
Prick her flesh! Prick her flesh!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 20
9: INT. CHURCH
FX: IN THE MIDST OF A WHISPERED PRAYER...
(CLOSE) .. O Mater Dei, memento mei. Did I do wrong to call the Witch-Pricker? He attests he serves Your glory. But his methods seem [the work of the Dev-]
FX: THE BIG CHURCH DOORS BANG OPEN!
(URGENT) Mary! Mary!
Who profanes this church with such disrespect? Tone down you voice, sir!
Um. Sorry. Didn’t mean to interrupt. I’m the Doctor. I’m looking for my friends. They said they’d be here.
A woman, in the company of two youths?
That’1ll be them. Where are they?
They disappeared the moment I arrived. I barely glimpsed the children before they scurried away. They stayed in shadow — as if avoiding my sight.
Did they indeed? Might I enquire as to your name?
Claude Portillon, sir. My family’s served this village since the Black Death.
You're the Squire! No wonder they kept their faces in shadow.
Although how they knew-?
Do you travel with Master Kincaid’s entourage? Is he close?
I really don’t think he and I would see eye to eye.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 21
(CONFIDENTIAL) I must admit that I, too, have reservations. I was praying for guidance when you arrived. I may have summoned Kincaid to Tranchard’s Fell a little too precipitately.
His kind are always summoned precipitately. Look, very sorry to rush like this, but I need to find my friends.
FX: THE BIG DOORS OPEN & CORNET STRIDES IN.
Squire Portillon! (HE NOTICES THE DOCTOR & STOPS) Oh.
Speak freely, Cornet. This gentleman and I were discussing... um.. church matters. Do you have news?
The Witch-Pricker’s here, sir. He bade me inform you immediately. Says he wants to address the village.
Oh my! Help me prepare the church, Cornet. We must make this a
Suitable pulpit for such a man as John Kincaid!
(SOTTO) This is going to be very ugly.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 22
10: EXT. TRANCHARD’S FELL (MAIN SQUARE
(FX: A COLUMN OF HORSES PASSES CLOSE BY. MARY AND THE TWINS SKULK IN AN ALLEY.)
(WHISPERS) They look like soldiers.
(WHISPERS) Stay hidden, both of you. Don’t let them see you.
(WHISPERS) Who are they?
(WHISPERS) I don’t know. But it’s best we keep out of their way.
(FX: THE HORSES’ HOOVES RECEDE. NOW THERE’S JUST THE GENERAL LOW BUZZ OF VILLAGE LIFE. A SMITHY’S HAMMERING SOMEWHERE. )
We need to get back to the TARDIS.
We need to wait for the Doctor. He’1ll have a plan.
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) He certainly will. Although there are one or two slightly fuzzy stages.
(OVERJOYED TO SEE HIM) Doctor! You found us!
No thanks to you. Next time, perhaps you could see a way to being where you say you’1ll be-?
There was someone in the church. The twins were unsettled by
him.
No we weren’t.
I was. He made my skin crawl. He looked like a ghost.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs
In a way he is. The Squire’s one of your ancestors, nice enough fellow, for the time.
We shouldn’t be here, Doctor. It’s not safe.
Page 23
I think. A
Yes. I’ve a feeling Tranchard’s Fell is about to go a little
mad, now that the Witch-Pricker’s in town.
Is that who just rode in?
Yep. So we need to find that lost Varaxil before he does.
I should take the twins back to the TARDIS. They’1l be safe
within until we’re done.
You should stay there as well, Mary. I won’t be far behind. I
promise.
What are you going to do?
I thought I might take in a show...
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 24
11: INT. CHURCH
(FX: MASTER KINCAID’S WORDS ECHO FROM THE PULPIT, AROUND THE CHURCH HALL...)

(ORATING) You all know me: I am John Kincaid, Parliament’s appointed jurisconsult in matters of witchcraft. And you know why I’m here: your village is under Satan’s heel. With The Lord’s blessing, I will purge the evil and save the souls of the just.
(FX: SUNDRY VILLAGERS CRY OUT THEIR ASSENT. THEY’RE GLAD HE’S HERE TO SAVE THEM. )

In France and in the Low Countries, there are whole villages not unlike Tranchard’s Fell that have fallen from grace. I hear such reports with a heavy heart. For those simple foreigners were not corrupt until strangers whispered the Devil’s call.
(FX: THE BIG CHURCH DOOR CREAKS OPEN. TRYING TO ENTER QUIETLY, AND FAILING MISERABLY. )

(UNCOMFORTABLE, VOICE ECHOING) Ah. Sorry. Don’t mind me. I’11 just find a seat at the back somewhere. (TO SEATED VILLAGERS ) Excuse me, do you mind? (MUCH SHUFFLING AND HARRUMPHING, AS THE CONGREGATION SHIFT UP TO LET HIM SIT. TO KINCAID AGAIN) Please, just carry on as if I’m not here...

(IRKED) I was saying — until strangers came, spreading infernal doctrines and wickedness. For evil is found not only in deeds, but in the very thoughts of men who seek to question the order of things.
(FX: HIS SPEECH CONTINUES UNDER AS WE CROSS TO THE DOCTOR WITH

elements.character: BEATRIX IN THE PEWS AT THE BACK

elements.text: [MASTER KINCAID:
elements.character: BEATRIX IN THE PEWS AT THE BACK

elements.text: Corruption and blasphemy will infect this land like a new plague, if they’re allowed to take root. They must be contained. They must be cleansed. The seed of Satan has been planted in every one of your sinful hearts. I am here to sow salt and lead the holy among you back to righteousness. I am here to strike down the damned without mercy! ]
elements.character: BEATRIX IN THE PEWS AT THE BACK
BEATRIX IN THE PEWS AT THE BACK

elements.text: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 25
elements.character: BEATRIX IN THE PEWS AT THE BACK

elements.text: (WHISPERED) Hello again.
(WHISPERED) You!
(WHISPERED) Sorry, didn’t catch your name before, with all the fruit, what with all the yelling and the inhumanity. I’m the Doctor.
(WHISPERED) Beatrix Butcher.

(WHISPERED) You know, Beatrix Butcher, you’d be surprised how little evil there is in the universe. Real, pure evil I mean. Lots of selfishness, blind prejudice, rampant egotism of course. But genuine evil is rarer than Chelonian teeth.
(WHISPERED) Shush! The Witch-Pricker’s speaking!
FX: NOW BACK TO KINCAID, FRONT AND CENTRE.
(BUILDING TO A CRESCENDO) My men will raise a cordon around this village. No-one will enter, no-one will leave — until I
have done The Lord’s work!
Save us!/Cast out the Devil!/Preserve us, Master Kincaid!
(BURIED AMONG THE CHEERS) He goes on a bit, doesn’t he?
HUSH!
FX: FADE
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 26
12: EXT. FOREST
(FX: FADE UP. A MILITARY CONTINGENT — HORSES’ HOOVES AND CLANKING BREASTPLATES. )
(OFF) You have your orders! A line around Tranchard’s Fell. None shall pass (DRAWS SWORD) save to the next life!
(FX: GRIM LAUGHTER FROM SOLDIERS. FOLIAGE RUSTLES. MARY AND THE TWINS ARE HIDING A SHORT DISTANCE FROM THE MERCENARIES. )
(SOTTO) The soldiers are here already!
(SOTTO) Oh, we should never have come here!
(SOTTO) You got us into this! You kidnapped us!

MARY: There’s a Church. We’1ll be safe in The Lord’s house. What will
MARY: you be doing, in the meantime?
DOCTOR: Never you mind. Just look after the children.
DOCTOR: (FX: MARY, LUCERN & FINICIA MOVE OFF. AS THEY DO, BEATRIX BREAKS OFF CHANTING. THE MOB CONTINUES. )
DOCTOR: 17
DOCTOR: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 18

BEATRIX: (HISSES, URGENT) Block your ears, sir! You don’t want to be listenin’ to words off the Devil’s own forked tongue!
DOCTOR: If there is a devil here, then I very much doubt he’s in Agnes Bates.
AGNES: (OFF, ADDRESSING THE MOB) There ain’t no Hell but what the ignorant build! None of you ain’t seen what I’ve seen! Other spheres in an infinite void. Silver ships sailing between the [stars] — !

DOCTOR: 18

VILLAGERS: Prick her flesh! Prick her flesh!

DOCTOR: I think. A

MASTER KINCAID: (IRKED) I was saying — until strangers came, spreading infernal doctrines and wickedness. For evil is found not only in deeds, but in the very thoughts of men who seek to question the order of things.

BEATRIX IN THE PEWS AT THE BACK: [MASTER KINCAID:
BEATRIX IN THE PEWS AT THE BACK: Corruption and blasphemy will infect this land like a new plague, if they’re allowed to take root. They must be contained. They must be cleansed. DOCTOR: (WHISPERED) You know, Beatrix Butcher, you’d be surprised how little evil there is in the universe. Real, pure evil I mean. Lots of selfishness, blind prejudice, rampant egotism of course. But genuine evil is rarer than Chelonian teeth.
BEATRIX: (WHISPERED) Shush! The Witch-Pricker’s speaking!

BEATRIX: HUSH!

BEATRIX: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 26

SQUIRE PORTILLON: The... the outsider?

SQUIRE PORTILLON: Oh. (SITS UP) We barely spoke. His manner was eccentric — but he seemed unexceptional.
MASTER KINCAID: Unexceptional? He evaded the finest troops I could muster in Lincoln. Such a feat smacks of sorcery. As does crippling you with a demonic charm.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: You can put your divine certainties aside on that account, Witch-Pricker. I was taken by surprise. Struck down from behind not by a spell, but by a stick.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: FINICIA [C17]: (OFF, APPROACHING) .. wielded by one of his acolytes, no doubt.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: Finicia! You shouldn’t have left the village. It’s not safe

MASTER KINCAID: Your daughter was most concerned for your welfare, sir.

MASTER KINCAID: FINICIA [C17]: You were too trusting of this outsider, father. Such manipulation is the Devil’s art.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: (UNCONVINCED) Perhaps...
MASTER KINCAID: You would do well to listen to your daughter, sir. She has
MASTER KINCAID: wisdom enough for both of you...
MASTER KINCAID: FINICIA [C17]: (MANIPULATIVE) Please, father. May I stay? Perhaps I can help...

MASTER KINCAID: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 33

MARY: He'll be here. I am sure of it. (SHE ISN’T) Quite... sure. But perhaps, just to ease your nerves, I should take a look outside. Now: which of these devices works the door...?

elements.text: PART TWO
NO REPRISE
20: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
(CALM, NARRATING) The Doctor’s time vessel is no mere machine. It is more like a favoured mare, docile in her master’s hand yet prone to chivvy and buck should another take the reins.
That is most assuredly how it felt to me...
(FX: FADE UP IN-FLIGHT FX. TARDIS OUT OF CONTROL. TILTING, BUCKING — CIRCUITS SPARKING! MARY, FINICIA AND LUCERN HURLED ABOUT. )
(CRYING OUT, PANICKED) What have you done!
Sequential regression! He told us the ship finds its way. We’re
being dragged back to the 215+ century!
You did this on purpose?
Never underestimate people younger than yourself. We’re cleverer than we look.
FX: ALARM SIGNAL PULSES
What’s that? Lucern?
(PANICKED) I dunno. It says: ‘Edge of the Vortex!’
Hold on tight!
FX: SPARKS! RENDING METAL! A PANEL CRASHES TO THE DECK!
SCREAMS!
FX: MARY SLAMS AGAINST THE WALL. THE SCENE CUTS DEAD.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 37
21: INT. BEATRIX’S FAMILY COTTAGE (NIGHT
FX: A RAT SCUTTLES & SQUEAKS. RAIN’S FALLING OUTSIDE.
SNORING
(FX: THE DOCTOR CLIMBS IN THROUGH THE WINDOW & CREEPS UP TO BEATRIX, SHAKING HER GENTLY)
(WHISPERS, URGENT) Beatrix!
BEATRIX KEEPS SNORING.
(LOUDER) Psst! Beatrix!
(GROGGY) What?
Shush! Don’t wake your father!
He’s deaf as a post. Here, how’d you know I lived here? Thought you were a stranger in the village.
Your name’s Beatrix Butcher. This is a butcher’s shop. It wasn’t that hard.
Oh. What do you want?
You.
I knew it. Men, you’re all the-
(OBLIVIOUS) There’s something on Vetter’s Tor. The Squire said he'd show me the way, but.. well, never mind the details. The thing is, I need a guide.
A guide, eh? What are you offering?
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 38
Isn’t that rather venal?
Dunno. Is it?
(RUMMAGING IN POCKETS) I... er... I don’t carry much currency...
Then you’re on your own. Shut the window on your way out.
FX: SHE TURNS OVER IN HER BLANKET.
But I do have this.
MUSIC: TWINKLE!
Lord ha’ mercy! Is it gold?
Better than gold: Galdrium, from Tridentia 3. Shines in the dark if you shake it, see.
FX: HE DOES SO; IT DOES; BEATRIX IS IMPRESSED
Have you got any more?
A dozen. Or two.
(JUMPS OUT OF BED) I’1l get me shawl, master.
(EMPHATIC) Doctor.
Whatever you say. Come on, it’1l be dawn soon!
FX: SHE OPENS THE DOOR. RAIN OUTSIDE GETS LOUDER.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 39
22: EXT. BARLEY FIELD (NIGHT
FX: RAIN. TALL BARLEY RUSTLES. THE DOCTOR AND BEATRIX WALK.
You could see the Tor from here, but for the clouds. There’s a problem though.
The Witch-Pricker’s mercenaries? Don’t worry, I’ve been past them twice already tonight.
How?
All this barley. The soldiers can’t see a thing — at least,
not while it’s dark.
Where’s your friend? The woman from the village square?
FX: THE DOCTOR STOPS, BEATRIX LIKEWISE.
She's... gone.
Is she coming back?
(CAN’T MASK HIS CONCERN) I don’t know.
A stranger. Adrift in a parish of witches and devils.
(SLIGHTLY FLIRTATIOUS) Must be lonely, like.
The clouds are clearing. The... um... tor?
See that peak, to the right of the moon? That’s Vetter’s Tor.
Doesn’t look far.
(LAUGHS) It’s a dozen miles at least.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 40
Ah, well. I can find my own way now, Beatrix. Thank you for your help.
But I can help more! I’m strong, I can carry things.
I don’t need anything carrying, thanks. Goodbye.
FX: HE BEGINS STRIDING OFF
(CALLING AFTER HIM) ‘sides, what would my father say if he knew a man broke into my bedchamber offering me gold?
FX: THE DOCTOR STOPS.
It wasn’t gold it was Galdrium.
Galdrium. I'll be sure to tell my father. I’m sure he’11 find that interesting.
(EXHALES) Oh, all right. At least with me you’1ll stay out of
trouble.
SQUEALS, CLAPS — SO HAPPY!
FX: SHE RUNS TO CATCH UP WITH HIM & THEY WALK OFF.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 41
23: INT. TRANCHARDS FOLLY (CORRIDOR

When my senses returned, I found the Doctor’s vessel at rest in the entrance hall of Tranchards Folly. We had returned from whence we began our journey - just as Lucern had predicted. I was alone, however — the twins were gone. Examination of the navigational mechanism proved unhelpful, for I did not dare attempt to fly the TARDIS myself. But it seemed that the twins had gathered more of its operation than I. They alone might help me recover the Doctor. The door control, at least, I could operate.
FX: THE TARDIS DOOR CREAKS OPEN
(CALLING, SOFTLY) Finicia! Lucern! Where are you? (NO RESPONSE) Please. We can’t stay here, we must return to the
Doctor!
(FX: SHE EXITS THE TARDIS, WALKS PAST US, ON INTO THE HOUSE. BEAT. FROM THE STILLNESS WE HEAR THE WITCH)
(MUTTERING TO SELF) Ikodar... Euclon.. Davarox.. heh.
FX: THE WITCH SHUFFLES ON. FADE
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 42
24: INT. TRANCHARDS FOLLY (STUDY

BEATRIX: (OFF) Ow! That hurts!

DOCTOR: (WHISPERS) No. But you might. You have to cloud your mind, Agnes. Suppress your gift. I need you to focus on something exceptionally mundane. What do you eat?

DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: (OFF) The girl is hollow.
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: (OFF) Like the rest of her species! (SIGHS) The old woman

AGNES: (GROANS AS SHE’S HAULED UPRIGHT) Whatizzit-—?
AGNES: LUCERN [C17]: No. Nothing. She seems particularly stupid, in fact. Little higher than a beast.

DOCTOR: (MOCK-WOOZY) What? I was having a sleep —

DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: He’s not human! Not of this world.

DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: Sister — he knows!

DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: We'll ask the questions.

DOCTOR: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 73

elements.text: PART THREE
NO REPRISE
41-44: DELETED
45: EXT. TRANCHARD’S FELL (MAIN SQUARE
(FX: A COCK CROWS. HAMMERING, SAWING: THE SOUNDS OF TIMBER
CONSTRUCTION. )
Make those posts strong, Cornet! Satan’s consorts will swing before the sun sets!
They’1l be equal to the task, Master Kincaid.
(APPROACHING) Could the scaffolding not wait until after the verdict is heard, Witch-Pricker? It seems a little premature.
It would be a pity to restrain such industriousness, Squire Portillon. Cornet Swallow and his men are raising hanging posts fit for a king, had we still a king to hang.
Even without a king, Master Kincaid, we must be kingly in meting out justice. I want a fair trial. There’1ll be no mob rule here.
I see, Squire. So what you’re saying is that you won’t believe these three are witches until they themselves confess it?
Precisely. (REALISES WHAT HE’S SAYING) No, wait! I never meant—
I know exactly what you meant, sir. And I shall draw proofs of their guilt soon enough — starting with the coven leader: the Doctor!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 75
46: INT. CELLS
FX: WATER DRIPS. CONSTRUCTION CAN BE HEARD OUTSIDE, MUFFLED.
I don’t understand it. I brought them twins into the world. Their little hearts nearly broke when their mother died. Good kids, both of ‘em, just as she was. They’d spare a lame dog.
The Lucien and Finicia you knew are gone, Agnes. They’ve been replaced. Changelings.
(SCOFFING) Now that sounds like sorcery, Doctor!
Thought you said there weren’t no such thing as magic.
There ain’t. Isn’t. But there is a wrecked alien spacecraft on Vetter’s Tor, Beatrix, and I’m very much afraid that’s worse.
For you two, you mean. Them nooses ain’t for me. Miss Portillon — Finicia — she’s my friend, she told me she were. She’ll see I don’t hang.
Then why are you down here?
You're guilty by association, Beatrix. You visited the spacecraft, with me. That makes you dangerous — at least in the eyes of the twins.
FX: 2 x FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING DOWN CORRIDOR OUTSIDE THROUGH:
Hush now, someone’s coming.
(FX: CELL DOOR’S UNBOLTED, SWINGS OPEN) Doctor. I trust you and your acolytes have all that you require?
To be frank, I’ve been imprisoned in better facilities.
Then I bring you joyous news: your discomfiture is nearly at an end. First we have the tedious formality of a confession. (FX: CLAPPING HANDS) Guards, bring him!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 76
47: INT. TRANCHARDS FOLLY (STUDY
(FX: ALEISTER’S BREATHING HARD — SCARED OUT OF HIS WITS BY THEIR ENCOUNTER WITH THE WITCH FROM THE WELL. )
We have to get out of the house. That thing will be back.
Alas, the doors will still be barred to us, as they were to the Witch. Now, then — stiffen your resolve, sir. You’re no help to me like this.

You’re right, of course. Look at this library! A blessed shrine to a man with a heart of oak. I know every detail of the 6t Baron’s life, but when I need a dash of his nobility and courage, I’m put to shame by — a girl.
You’d be surprised, I think, how much time Byron spent hiding behind women’s skirts.
(PULLING HIMSELF TOGETHER) So then — what’s the plan?
The cage that snared the witch was insubstantial. Did you see how its flux made the poor thing dance before it faded, like one of Signore Galvani’s severed limbs?
Signore Galvani?
We must investigate the provenance of those unearthly energies.
Well I can assure you you’ll get no help from any of the
volumes on these shelves. It’s all history and biography.
Then we must return to the TARDIS. (STRIDES OFF) Come along.
FX: ALEISTER FOLLOWS.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 77
48: INT. MANOR HOUSE (MAIN HALL
FX: KINCAID TIGHTENS VARIOUS SCREWS & CLAMPS.
I say, is this a genuine Inquisitional chair, or just a reproduction? I’ve always wanted to see the real McCoy.

There’s nothing unreal about this chair, Doctor. Except, perhaps, the pain it can inflict. (FINISHES TIGHTENING THE SCREWS) The clamps holding your wrists, chest and legs can be tightened, making the spikes on the back, the seat and in the arm rests more... vexing. If you prove uncooperative, that is.
If I don’t confess, you mean.

Quite so, Doctor. Now, before we employ the chair’s more imaginative features, why not simply confess? Tell me freely how you’ve served Satan and denounced our Lord. Admit you corrupted Agnes Bates and the other wench, as you planned to corrupt this village. Confess to that and I’1ll release you from this chair at once.

CORNET SWALLOW: Sir!
SQUIRE PORTILLON: (TO SELF) And then I shall have words with your “Witch- Pricker”!
SQUIRE PORTILLON: 93
SQUIRE PORTILLON: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 94
SQUIRE PORTILLON: (FX: MARY AND ALEISTER, RUNNING ON WOOD FLOORS — BOTH BREATHING HARD. THEY CAN HEAR FISTS HAMMERING ON A DOOR, UP AHEAD. MUFFLED SHRIEKS FROM THE WITCH FROM THE WELL. )
ALEISTER: (RUNNING) Second floor landing! Sounds like the creature’s caught! Thank goodness!
MARY: (RUNNING) This is all wrong. Listen to those screams! It’s terrified! I fear we’ve misidentified the victim in this dreadful affair.
ALEISTER: (RUNNING) Just up here — (SEES LUCERN & FINICIA WAITING, SKIDS TO STOP) Woah!
MARY: Lucern! Finicia! What in heaven’s name are you doing?
FINICIA: We knew you were looking for us. We’re sorry we hid. Only we have a mission, you see.
LUCERN: A sacred oath. We have to catch the witch.
MARY: Where is she? The witch?
FINICIA: Trapped behind that door. Caught in our Lokic web.
FINICIA: (FX: HAMMERING GROWS WILDER. PRIMAL SHRIEKS FROM THE OTHER SIDE. )
ALEISTER: Those screams!
MARY: What living thing can endure such pain?
FINICIA: None. Which is why we have to take the life from it.
MARY: You’1ll do no such thing!
MARY: 94
MARY: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 95
AGNES: (QUIETLY) She was dim, she was selfish — but Beatrix didn’t deserve to die. Not like that!
DOCTOR: No-one deserves to die like that, Agnes.
AGNES: (STARTLED) Finicia! You shouldn’t be here. If Kincaid were to [find you] -
AGNES: FINICIA [C17]: But this is our home.
AGNES: LUCERN [C17]: We’re the Squire’s children. Whatever the Doctor says.
AGNES: FINICIA [C17]: You birthed us, healer. You took us from our mother’s womb.
DOCTOR: Oh, I think she did rather more than that. Didn’t you, Agnes? The peasant girl and the Squire. The village gossips were right, weren’t they?
AGNES: I don’t know what you mean, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Oh, come on! This pair tried to have you burned alive, and still you don’t believe there’s a bad bone in them. Talk about maternal instinct.
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: But we took their memories! How did we not know?
AGNES: (WITH A HEAVY SIGH) The Squire’s wife didn’t die in childbirth, she died o’ the pox. But since I were pregnant by the Squire already, his poor dead wife’s ‘confinement’ were all the cover needed. When my time came, he took you from me and claimed you were hers. Better that, than for the pair of you to be branded illegitimate.
DOCTOR: Agnes — these are not your children. They’re Varaxils.
DOCTOR: 95
DOCTOR: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 96
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: We took your children’s memories, Agnes Bates.
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: Everything they were, we are.
DOCTOR: Stop it! Both of you! That’s a lie and you know it! (GENTLY) I don’t think they meant to harm Finicia and Lucern, Agnes. That’s not why they came here. I think they’re here to save you.
AGNES: Save me? No.
AGNES: 96
AGNES: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 97
AGNES: (FX: THE TRAPPED WITCH’S HAMMERING BEHIND THE DOOR CONTINUES. HER SHRIEKS HAVE STOPPED, SHE’S BACK TO MUTTERING NAMES: )
WITCH: (MUFFLED) Karavax. Neya. Illutem. Li’huan of Merkus. Rakib undead. Oluro. Narii. Nazev...
MARY: (OVER THE WITCH) Listen to her! She’s hurt and afraid. Finicia, Lucern — come with me to the TARDIS, show me how to re-engage the controls. We’1l find the Doctor, he’1ll know what to do for the best.
LUCERN: Do you hear, sister? She thinks the Gallifreyan will help her.
FINICIA: Such a stupid woman. Don’t you know that without the Doctor,
FINICIA: none of this would have happened?
MARY: How dare you blame the Doctor for this!
FINICIA: Be silent! We’ve waited so long to accomplish our mission.
FINICIA: Brother, are you ready?
LUCERN: Yes, sister.
ALEISTER: The Witches’ Star!
WITCH: (MUFFLED, TERRIFIED) Orfak! Osidarax! Rakhi!
FINICIA: Open the door, brother. Let’s end this.
FINICIA: 97
FINICIA: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 98
DOCTOR: I should have understood when I found your crashed ship. What would a race that embraced Odic power want with a hold full of Lokic containment webs?
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: You overestimate yourself, Doctor. You don’t understand at all.
DOCTOR: Then, on the gallows, with the flames around us, it suddenly made sense: you’d sentenced us to death not because you’d detected Agnes’ higher evolution, but because you hadn't. Because I’d stupidly told her to conceal it from you. The Varaxils travel the stars in search of Odic sensitives, like that poor flux imp you took from the Pherkad array. Like Agnes.
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: Like our mother.
DOCTOR: Your race knows from experience how a gift like hers inspires hate and prejudice. You vowed to save others from the same fate. So you collect them, you preserve them in stasis in your ship’s hold, you take them to your homeworld. The only planet in the galaxy where they can live free from persecution. Is that about the size of it?
AGNES: (SO VERY SAD) Oh Doctor. You couldn’t be more wrong.
DOCTOR: Agnes?
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: The witch sees the truth, Doctor.
AGNES: Every beast, fish and fowl across the infinity of worlds condemned their infernal engines. The Varaxils were outcasts.
DOCTOR: (IMPATIENT) I know that.
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]:
DOCTOR: Yet you’ve failed to grasp what follows from that simple fact. When the universe proclaims your very existence to be abhorrent, Doctor, what then?
DOCTOR: (DAWNING REALISATION) No...
DOCTOR: 98
DOCTOR: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 99
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: (SATISFACTION) Now he understands.
AGNES: They travel the stars, Doctor, seeking souls such as mine. But they don’t want to save us.
AGNES: LUCERN [C17]: We drain their profane essence. We chain them in Lokic webs. We take them back to Varax Beta.
DOCTOR: And you kill them.
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: We’re not monsters, Doctor.
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: We bury them alive in tombs of reinforced tyrillium, six miles deep.
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]:
DOCTOR: Two centuries ago, we began by smashing the heretical machines that had made us so despised. Then we rounded up the Odic mutations among our own kind.
AGNES: They herded them — us — into camps, Doctor. Like animals.
AGNES: LUCERN [C17]:
AGNES: But that wasn’t enough. We had to do penance. The Varaxils had to prove beyond doubt that we had truly abandoned our sinful technologies. So we became a scourge. We swore a sacred oath: to eradicate Odic power from the cosmos.
AGNES: FINICIA [C17]:
AGNES: That’s what happens if you tell a race their very civilisation is an affront to creation, Doctor. Say it often enough, say it for millennia, never stop saying it...
DOCTOR: (APPALLED) .. and finally, one day, you believe it.
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]:
DOCTOR: Every Varaxil has vowed to hunt down those hideous abominations, across all space and time. Isn’t that what you all wanted?
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: Time to end this, Doctor. Time to kill the witch.
DOCTOR: 99
DOCTOR: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 100
MASTER KINCAID: An excellent meal. My thanks for your hospitality, Squire.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: A final courtesy, nothing more. By tomorrow, I want you and your men far away from this village. There’s been a madness here since you arrived, Witch-Pricker, and it ends tonight.
MASTER KINCAID: (POURS WINE) I’ve no wish to intrude where I’m unwelcome. But I have Parliament’s contract to fulfil. Before I leave, I must perform one last investigation.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: As long as you’re gone by dawn, I’ve no objection.
MASTER KINCAID: Good. In that case... tell me about your children.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: My... my children?
MASTER KINCAID: It’s a fair question. When the Doctor claimed Lucern and Finicia were changelings, you seemed almost ready to believe him. Then, the twins themselves affirmed they’d been possessed.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: (QUIET) They’re all I have. Please, Witch-Pricker. This once, find mercy.
MASTER KINCAID: Regretfully, I’ve no choice in the matter. I’1ll speak with them immediately. Pretty Finicia first, I think. I presume
MASTER KINCAID: she’s upstairs — abed?
SQUIRE PORTILLON: (OUTRAGED) You will stay away from her!
MASTER KINCAID: (CALLING) Cornet!
MASTER KINCAID: 100
MASTER KINCAID: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 101
CORNET SWALLOW: Now sir! Settle, if you please.
MASTER KINCAID: Be prudent, Squire. Cornet Swallow has enough blood on his
MASTER KINCAID: hands. Don’t force him to add you to his tally.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: Damn you!
MASTER KINCAID: Make sure he stays here, Cornet. If you’1l excuse me, Squire, I’ve The Lord’s work to do.
SQUIRE PORTILLON: (OFF, HELPLESS) Stay away from my daughter!
SQUIRE PORTILLON: 101
SQUIRE PORTILLON: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 102
SQUIRE PORTILLON: LUCERN [C17]: This device is a WitchStar Configuration. Our race’s highest achievement, forged in the Hecatrix Dimension.
DOCTOR: Are you mad? Witch Dimension science is unstable in this reality. And you’re using it around Lokic fields! Don’t you know how dangerous that is?
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]:
DOCTOR: The WitchStar drains the blasphemous energies of our prey. With it, we can contain them safely for transport to the homeworld.
DOCTOR: And the husks in the barn? Accidents, I suppose?
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: We had no chance to adjust the settings. All life has traces of Odic energy.
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: We’d just crashed on this world. The farmer threatened us. Then we found the children.
AGNES: (IN QUIET GRIEF) My babies.
AGNES: LUCERN [C17]:
AGNES: We’ll end your pain, mother. Your childrens’ essences are within the WitchStar, among a thousand other souls. You can join them.
AGNES: (GETTING WEAKER) Doctor..!
DOCTOR: Switch it off! Can’t you see it’s killing her?
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: That’s rather the point, Doctor.
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]:
DOCTOR: If our ship were intact, we’d subdue her and seal her ina Lokic web. Then we’d deliver her to Varax Beta with our other captives.
DOCTOR: 102
DOCTOR: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 103
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: But since we’ll not be leaving this ball of mud, we may as well kill her, here and now.
MASTER KINCAID: (OFF) Finicia? Are you here, child? Your father has asked me to speak with you.
DOCTOR: (YELLS) Witch-Pricker! In here!
MASTER KINCAID: By Heaven! What devilry is this?
DOCTOR: The pendant in the boy’s hand! Seize it!
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: No!
MASTER KINCAID: (GRABBING IT) I have it! This is a treasure indeed. Much too good for the daughter of a village squire.
MASTER KINCAID: FINICIA [C17]: Give it to me! You don’t know what you’re doing!
DOCTOR: See the jewelled bead, Witch-Pricker? That’s it, now twist it. Good!
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: Shut up! (HITS HIM!)
DOCTOR: Ooof!
DOCTOR: (FX: WITCHSTAR’S ULULATIONS DECREASE — GRADUALLY DYING AWAY. AGNES MOANS)
DOCTOR: Agnes? Agnes? Are you all right?
AGNES: (GASPING) So weak...
MASTER KINCAID: A strange trinket. It seems almost infernal.
MASTER KINCAID: 103
MASTER KINCAID: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 104
MASTER KINCAID: FINICIA [C17]: Please, Master Kincaid. Don’t touch the WitchStar.
MASTER KINCAID: The pendant! I can’t let go! It’s alive in my hand!
DOCTOR: (YELLING ABOVE THE DIN) Lucern! What’s happening?
DOCTOR: LUCERN [C17]: He’s released the Odic reservoir!
DOCTOR: FINICIA [C17]: A thousand lifeforces — set free!
AGNES: A million stars igniting! A sea of souls!
DOCTOR: Agnes! Stand back!
AGNES: (IN AGONY) I know their names! Ardax! Eraktath!
MASTER KINCAID: Doctor — the witch is aflame!
DOCTOR: Too much power! She can’t absorb it, nothing living could! Get
DOCTOR: out of here, before she —!
AGNES: (FX: BOOM! THE BEDROOM — THE HOUSE — BLASTED APART! AND ABOVE IT ALL, AGNES HOWLING, BURNING WITH ODIC POWER. SHE DOESN'T
AGNES: EVEN SOUND HUMAN ANYMORE — SHE SOUNDS LIKE THE WITCH FROM THE WELL! )
AGNES: END OF PART THREE
AGNES: 104
AGNES: DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 105

elements.text: PART FOUR
NO REPRISE
64: EXT. DEMOLISHED MANOR HOUSE (NIGHT
(FX: FIRES ARE STILL BURNING, BUT GUTTERING BY NOW; A COUPLE
OF HOURS HAVE PASSED SINCE THE BLAST. SQUIRE PORTILLON
SCRABBLES AMONG THE RUINS. HE SHIFTS SOME DEBRIS. )
John Kincaid. Can you hear me, Witch-Pricker?
MOANS
You’re trapped. I’11 dislodge this beam. It may cause you some pain. Three, two, one! (FX: HE LIFTS A HEAVY TIMBER ASIDE.)
GROANS
Give me your arm and I’11 pull you free.
FX: HE DOES. BRICKS ARE DISLODGED. MORE GROANING.
By all that’s holy, Squire! Thank the Lord that fiend is gone!
She is with us still. Look towards Vetter’s Tor.
What?! (GASPS) Tranchard’s Fell is aflame!
And in the sky above?
By all the demons: she looks like a hawk from Hell.
Agnes Bates attacked the village. No mercy, no quarter. Your mercenaries are standing their ground as we bear the wounded to sanctuary. I came back to find you.
And the Doctor?
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 106
65: EXT. TRANCHARD’S FELL (MAIN SQUARE
(FX: FIRES BURNING — PUNCTUATED BY EXPLOSIONS. WE’RE IN THE MIDDLE OF A POCKET BLITZ!)
AGNES/WITCH: (OFF, HOWLING) Atviir! — Kulisarn! — Hitzo! — Zeraxi!
(FX: A VOLLEY OF MUSKET-FIRE. THE AGNES/WITCH SHRIEKS AND LAUGHS, CIRCLING AND SWOOSHING IN THE SKY ABOVE. ANOTHER EXPLOSION, MUCH CLOSER — SOLDIERS SCREAM AND DIE!)
Fall back, men! Find cover!
There’s someone out there, sir! In the line of fire!
(FX: RUNNING ACROSS THE SQUARE — PURSUED BY A LINE OF ENERGY BOLTS LIKE TRACER SHELLS!)
It’s the Doctor! (SHOUTS) Run, man! Run! Over here! Take my hand! Here soldier: help me pull him over the wall.
(FX: STRAINING, THEY HAUL THE DOCTOR INTO COVER. IN THE AIR ABOVE, THE AGNES/WITCH HOWLS AND SWOOSHES AWAY. )
Great heavens, man! Are you mad? What are you doing in the open?
(BREATHING HARD) Trying to talk to Agnes. Or whatever Agnes has become. A pointless exercise, alas.
You’re lucky that creature didn’t send your soul to Hell!
Tell me. The wounded, from the ruins of the manor house. Where
were they taken?
The church. Where else?
Can you get me there in one piece?
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 107
66: INT. TRANCHARDS FOLLY (CORRIDOR
(FX: A LOKIC CONTAINMENT WEB CRACKLES. THE CREATURE FROM THE WELL’S BEHIND IT, FLAILING AND HISSING. THE WITCHSTAR CONFIGURATION ULULATES — MAXIMUM POWER! )
Demoz of Rexet. Iroox Sigma. High Imperatrix Teluush...
Full power to the WitchStar, brother!
It is at full power, sister!
Look, I know this isn’t a good time. But who are you and what are you doing going round claiming to be my children?
Don’t you recognise us, my Lord?
You’re the nephew of our great-great-great-[great-] —
(IMPATIENT) They’re family, Aleister. That’s all you need to know.
(FADING) Ixomin. The Kalazed. Valleziuc...
Sister mine! The Witch is fading! The Configuration cannot hold
her!
No! She must not evade us again!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 108
67: INT. CHURCH
(FX: WE CAN HEAR THE FIRES, THE EXPLOSIONS AND THE AGNES/ WITCH’S SHRIEKS — BUT THEY’RE OUTSIDE, MUFFLED. THE CHURCH’S
INTERIOR IS FILLED WITH THE GROANS OF THE INJURED.
(WALKING THROUGH, IN PAIN HIMSELF) My troopers are the finest mercenaries in Lincoln, deserters from Parliament’s own. They’1l take that devil down. This will be a glorious victory.
(WALKING) The wounded and dying would dispute there’s glory here. But Tranchard’s Fell is in debt to any man who’1ll raise a pike or fire a matchlock against that abomination.
(FX: THE CHURCH DOORS BANG OPEN. THE DOCTOR ENTERS, ACCOMPANIED BY THE SOLDIER WHO SAVED HIM. )
Cornet Swallow — you were ordered to protect this church from the witch! How dare you abandon the field?
(APPROACHING) Sir, I found this man in the main square. He demanded to speak with the Squire’s twins.
(WAVING) Hello again.
MASTER KINCAID/SQUIRE PORTILLON: Doctor?!?
The very same. And before you say it, Witch-Pricker, yes I daresay I do have the luck of the Devil. Now, where are Finicia and Lucern?
My children are in the chancel with the rest of the wounded, Doctor. They may not survive.
Ah.
Faith will deliver us all, Doctor.
Begging your pardon sir, but you haven’t faced that thing. Our pikes and musket-balls can’t get near her.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 109
What happened to the WitchStar Configuration, Kincaid? After you triggered it at the manor house?
The young girl’s pendant? Lost in the explosion, I imagine.

Pity. Still, without the twins I doubt we could operate it anyway. Odic technology’s arcane, it doesn’t follow physical laws. (THEN, THOUGHTFUL) On the other hand, a Lokic field’s simple as hydrogen, helium, lithium.
There is rarely anything simple in what you say, Doctor.
Sorry. Sometimes even I don’t understand what I’m talking about. Cornet Swallow: can you muster half a dozen of your finest men and get me to Vetter’s Tor?
Those troops are under my command, Doctor! I will not have you [giving orders] —
I’d be glad to ride with you, Doctor. But I can’t leave men here to face that witch without a leader.
How about you, Kincaid? They’re under your command, after all.
I’m... a man of the church. Not a soldier. In fact, I believe it’s the Lord’s design that I go with you to Vetter’s Tor.
Oh that’s perfect. A frightened zealot with a God complex. What could possibly go wrong?
This village is my responsibility, Cornet. I’1ll be honoured if your men will allow me to lead them.
The honour will be theirs, sir.
If we fail on Vetter’s Tor, you’ll die here, Squire.
Well, it wouldn’t be my first error of judgement, would it now?
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 110
68: INT. TRANCHARDS FOLLY (CORRIDOR
FX: AS BEFORE
(FADING) Atviir! — Kulisarn! — Hitzo! — Zeraxi!
The Lokic web should suppress her power. Yet she’s already translucent!
Now look here. I don’t have the foggiest what any of this is about, and Lord knows I don’t owe that creature any favours — but if she’s going, let her go!
FX: BEHIND THE ELECTRIC FIELD, THE WITCH SNARLS PLAINTIVELY
Well said, Aleister. (TO TWINS) Whatever her language, it’s plain enough the creature’s in agony. And whatever her crimes, you’ve no right to make her suffer!
We have an oath.
FX: THE CREATURE SNARLS AGAIN — SOUNDING DISTANT & DISTORTED
Restrain the witch, brother! If she slips from our grasp, our sacred mission fails!
(GASPING FOR BREATH) The Slazeen.. Mumix of Alasus Cluster... Pelamast...
I say! Isn’t she...?
Exactly! (TO TWINS) Lucern, Finicia — can’t you see? The witch isn’t escaping — she’s changing!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 111
69: EXT. VETTER’S TOR
FX: 9 x HORSES IN MOTION. A SMALL COLUMN OF RIDERS.
(ON HORSEBACK) How many times do I have to tell you: Agnes is not a witch?

(ON HORSEBACK) If there were truly monsters from the heavens as you claim, Doctor, then I would have long since taken to my heels and fled like a boy in skirts. I’ve no protection against such things. But Agnes is a witch and my faith will defend me against Satan’s black arts.
(ON HORSEBACK) So this Divine purge of yours isn’t an act? You’re really here to save Tranchard’s Fell?
(ON HORSEBACK) I am. I defend the Protectorate and all who serve under it.

(ON HORSEBACK) Ah, so one eye on the heavens and one firmly on your future employment prospects. Rid Tranchard’s Fell of its resident witch and your reputation grows, your name’s lauded all across the Protectorate. Who knows, you might even catch the eye of Cromwell. That’s less a holy crusade, more a career opportunity. (CALLING OUT) Whoa! We’re here.
FX: THE HORSES STOP.
I see no wrecked freighter.
(DISMOUNTING) It’s buried. See that opening in the hillside? That’s the entrance to below decks.
(CALLING) Arm yourselves, lads. We’re going in!

Sorry, Swallow, but you’re not. I need to find an empty Lokic web in there and disconnect it, so we can take it back to Tranchard’s Fell. It’ll be a lot easier without your men cluttering up the place.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 112
(DISMOUNTING) That’s as maybe, Doctor. But I would see this devil’s lair for myself.
Very well, Witch-Pricker. Although I should warn you: your view of the universe is about to be seriously expanded.
Less verbosity, Doctor. More alacrity.
First sensible thing I’ve heard you say. Come on, you can give
me a hand with the hatch.
FX: THEY STRIDE OFF TOWARDS THE ENTRANCE
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 113
70: INT. VARAXTL SHIP
(FX: THE SHIP’S ‘CIRCUIT HEARTBEAT’ PULSES. THE HATCH OPENS & THE DOCTOR AND KINCAID CLAMBER DOWN LADDER)

(FX: CLIMBING DOWN LADDER) Most of these webs are occupied. The Varaxils must’ve spent a lifetime capturing and imprisoning their prey before they crashed on Earth. (FX: FEET ON FLOOR) There are creatures here from all over your galaxy.
(FX: FEET ON FLOOR) Such monsters!
(FX: A LOKIC CONTAINMENT WEB CRACKLES AS KINCAID PROBES IT. FROM WITHIN, A SENSUOUS FEMALE VOICE LAUGHS — ERISI LAUGHTER FROM ‘THE ENTROPY COMPOSITION’ )
Please, don’t disturb the Erisi. Help me find an empty containment web. Ah, here’s one!
This place is a blasphemous second Ark.

(TWIDDLING WITH THE EMPTY LOKIC WEB) Oh, this is interesting! These units trap the Odic power within their prisoners — not the prisoners themselves. That’s why the flux imp wasn’t sucked dry when it died, like those husks in the barn.
(FX: SUDDEN MELEE OUTSIDE, MUFFLED BY AIRLOCK. SOLDIERS SHOUT, HORSES WHINNY. ABOVE IT ALL, AGNES/WITCH SHRIEKS AND HOWLS! )
The witch! She’s followed us!
FX: EXPLOSIONS TOP-SIDE! MEN SCREAMING AS THEY’RE ATOMIZED!
Change of plan! We’re not taking the containment web back to the village anymore — we need to trap her down here!
(FX: MORE SCREAMS — THE SOLDIERS HAVE FAILED! AGNES/WITCH IS SCUTTLING DOWN THE ENTRY LADDER! )
AGNES/WITCH: (MUTTERS) Amisovan — Ezrir of Traken — Onivilet —
Dear Lord! The witch is upon us!
FX: AGNES/WITCH SWOOSHES INTO THE VARAXIL CRAFT — SHRIEKING!
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 114
71: INT. TRANCHARDS FOLLY (CORRIDOR
(FX: THE ELECTRIC CRACKLE OF THE LOKIC BARRIER. FROM BEHIND IT, A VOICE. ANCIENT, CRACKED — BUT ALL TOO RECOGNISABLE: )
(OFF, DISTORTED) Help me...
Look at her! She’s changed into a woman. A human!
I know her! I saw her once before, in Tranchard’s Fell!
She’s altered her form! Stop her, brother! STOP THE WITCH!
(FIRMLY) No! This ends here.
What did you say?
I have had quite enough of your wilfulness for one day, young girl! Unlock the TARDIS controls and return us to the Doctor.
I am Third Trierarch to the Varax Citrine! How dare you speak to me like that?
You will do as I say, young lady. And you will do it no
FX: SLAPS HER FACE!
(SEETHING) In 350 years, not one of the hollow primitives on this malodorous little planet has dared lay a hand on me!
Well. That was most remiss of them.
FURIOUS HOWL!
FX: A STRUGGLE. GASPS OF PAIN — FINICIA WINS
Hold her, sister! I’1ll drain her to a husk — then we’ll deal with the witch.
DOCTOR WHO - THE WITCH FROM THE WELL by Rick Briggs Page 115
Now listen here, young man. (LUCERN PUNCHES HIM) Oof!
You'll be next ‘father’.
(FX: DOPPLER EFFECT, AS THE WITCHSTAR CONFIGURATION TURNS TOWARDS MARY. SHE STRUGGLES HARDER. )
They always fight to survive. Don’t they know it only makes the process more painful?
(WINDED) Please. You mustn’t —
(STRUGGLING, QUOTING FROM BOOK SHE READ IN PART 3) Aleister! The Doctor’s book: “The technology of the Witch Dimension is unstable...”
It’ll prove more than stable enough to atomize you.
Aleister! Remember: “”.. Prone to catastrophic failure [in proximity to fields of Lokic force] -”
. in proximity to fields of Lokic force." Of course! (HE LUNGES. THUMP! LUCERN GRUNTS, FALLS AGAINST THE WALL.) I have it! I have the Witches’ Star!
Hand it over, fool. If the WitchStar touches the containment web, the consequences could be catastrophic!
(CHARGING ALEISTER) Give that back!
(CHARGED) Ooof!
FX: WITCHSTAR GOES FLYING. PERHAPS A MUSICAL SHING! HERE
Catch it! Don’t let it —
